gw.bc.account.entity

Interface Account

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.bc.domain.account.gen.AccountStubI, Bean, com.guidewire.commons.entity.BundleProvider, java.lang.Comparable<Bean>, DelinquencyTarget, DocumentContainer, com.guidewire.bc.domain.document.gen.DocumentContainerStubI, Editable, EventAware, com.guidewire.pl.domain.messaging.gen.EventAwareStubI, HistoryEventContainer, com.guidewire.bc.domain.history.gen.HistoryEventContainerStubI, HoldRelatedEntity, com.guidewire.bc.domain.troubleticket.gen.HoldRelatedEntityStubI, IGosuObject, InCurrencySilo, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.InCurrencySiloStubI, InvoicePayer, InvoiceStreamInvoicingSettingsProvider, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Keyable, KeyableBean, NoteContainer, com.guidewire.bc.domain.note.gen.NoteContainerStubI, Retireable, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Sourceable, TAccountOwner, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.TAccountOwnerStubI, Validatable, com.guidewire.pl.domain.validation.gen.ValidatableStubI, Versionable

      • hasActiveAccountLevelDelinquencyProcesses

        boolean hasActiveAccountLevelDelinquencyProcesses()
        Returns:
        true if there exists at least one active delinquency process for the account level charges (as opposed to collateral or policy level delinquency processes)

      • getAccountInfo

        @Deprecated
AccountInfo getAccountInfo()
        Deprecated. (since 8.0.1) use AccountInfoDTO#valueOf(Account) instead.
        The AccountInfo returned by this method is only a snapshot. See the description of the fields on AccountInfo to get more details about what information is included in this call.
        Returns:
        the status of the given account, represented by an AccountInfo non-persistent entity.

      • getApplicableDelinquencyPlans

        Returns:

      • getAvailableForDisbursement

        MonetaryAmount getAvailableForDisbursement()
        Returns the amount available for disbursement for the account's unapplied t-account, which depends on the AvailableDisbAmtType (field on BillingPlan). This is for default unapplied only. If you would like to use this for designated unapplied, use UnappliedFund.getAvailableForDisbursement() If the type is "UnappliedMinusAUC", then this is unapplied - remaining balance. If the type is "UnappliedMinusBilled", then this is unapplied - max(0, (billed + due)).
        Returns:
        amount available for disbursement

      • getAvailableForDisbursement

        @Deprecated
MonetaryAmount getAvailableForDisbursement(UnappliedFund unapplied)
        Deprecated. Use UnappliedFund.getAvailableForDisbursement() instead (Since 8.0.0)
        Returns the amount available for disbursement for an unapplied t-account (passed in via UnappliedFund), which depends on the AvailableDisbAmtType (field on BillingPlan). If the type is "UnappliedMinusAUC", then this is unapplied - remaining balance. If the type is "UnappliedMinusBilled", then this is unapplied - max(0, (billed + due)).
        Parameters:
        unapplied - the unapplied t-account
        Returns:
        amount available for disbursement

      • getPaymentDistributionPolicyPeriods

        PolicyPeriod[] getPaymentDistributionPolicyPeriods()
        Returns:
        policies on this account that participate in Account-level Payment Distribution. All policies on the account accept payments if the distribution is direct to the specific policy or if the distribution is direct to an invoice at which the policy is part of.

      • getPendingDisbursementAmount

        MonetaryAmount getPendingDisbursementAmount()
        Returns:
        MonetaryAmount Returns the amount of money that has been allocated for disbursement already for the account's unapplied t-account. This is the sum of the amount field on all disbursements on this account with status approved or awaiting approval.

      • getPendingDisbursementAmount

        @Deprecated
MonetaryAmount getPendingDisbursementAmount(UnappliedFund unapplied)
        Deprecated. Use UnappliedFund.getPendingDisbursementAmount() instead (Since 8.0.0)
        Parameters:
        unapplied - The unapplied t-account for the pending disbursement
        Returns:
        MonetaryAmount Returns the amount of money that has been allocated for disbursement already for the designated unapplied. This is the sum of the amount field on all disbursements on this account with status approved or awaiting approval.

      • getPrimaryPayer

        AccountContact getPrimaryPayer()
        Returns:
        the AccountContact with the primary accountContact bit set to true. Returns the first AccountContact found (if multiple primary payers exist, which is not expected).

      • getRawUnbilledAmount

        MonetaryAmount getRawUnbilledAmount()
        Returns:
        the balance of the unbilled T-account at the account-level only (i.e., not aggregated over children policies)

      • getRawBilledAmount

        MonetaryAmount getRawBilledAmount()
        Returns:
        Balance of the billed T-account of the account, not including policy periods or collateral.

      • getRawPaidAmount

        MonetaryAmount getRawPaidAmount()
        Returns:
        the raw paid amount is the result of the following calculation of six T-accounts: Revenue + Unearned - Billed - Due - Unbilled - Writeoff Expense This is the same as PolicesPaidAmount, but for the account, not the policy periods.

      • getPoliciesPaidAmount

        MonetaryAmount getPoliciesPaidAmount()
        Returns:
        The sum of the paid amount on all policy periods. The paid amount on a policy period is a calculation of six T-accounts: (Revenue + Unearned - Billed - Due - Unbilled - Writeoff Expense)

      • getRawDelinquentAmount

        MonetaryAmount getRawDelinquentAmount()
        Returns:
        the amount delinquent (max of RawDueAmount and zero) at the account level only (i.e., not aggregated over children policies)

      • getPoliciesDelinquentAmount

        MonetaryAmount getPoliciesDelinquentAmount()
        Returns:
        the total value at the policy level only. This is the sum of the DelinquentAmount on all policy periods. The DelinquentAmount on a policy period is Max(0, DueAmount)

      • getRawDueAmount

        MonetaryAmount getRawDueAmount()
        Returns:
        the amount due at the account level only (i.e., not aggregated over children policies). This is the balance of the due T-account.

      • getRawOutstandingAmount

        MonetaryAmount getRawOutstandingAmount()
        Returns:
        the amount outstanding at the account level only (i.e., not aggregated over children policies). This equals RawBilledAmount + RawDueAmount.

      • getRawTotalValue

        MonetaryAmount getRawTotalValue()
        Returns:
        the total value at the account level only (i.e., not aggregated over children policies). This is the sum of the Revenue and Unearned T-accounts for the account, not including policy periods or collateral.

      • getPoliciesTotalValue

        MonetaryAmount getPoliciesTotalValue()
        Returns:
        sum of the revenue and unearned T-accounts on all policy periods.

      • getRawUnpaidAmount

        MonetaryAmount getRawUnpaidAmount()
        Returns:
        RawTotalValue - RawPaidAmount - Writeoff expense (T-account balances)

      • getRawRemainingBalance

        MonetaryAmount getRawRemainingBalance()
        Returns:
        RawOutstandingAmount + RawUnbilledAmount

      • getTotalUnappliedAmount

        MonetaryAmount getTotalUnappliedAmount()
        Returns:
        the sum of default unapplied balance and the balance of any designated unapplieds

      • doNegativeWriteoff

        AcctNegativeWriteoff doNegativeWriteoff(MonetaryAmount amount,
                                      WriteoffChannel channel)
        Performs a negative writeoff transaction on this account for the given amount. The channel parameter indicates whether the writeoff originated from the UI, or whether it was created programmatically.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to negatively writeoff
        channel - the context for how the writeoff was created: UI or API.
        Returns:
        the Account Negative Writeoff created

      • addHold

        TroubleTicket addHold(HoldType[] holdTypes)
        Adds a hold to this account using the specified hold types. Creates a trouble ticket to manage the holds, and returns the created trouble ticket.
        Parameters:
        holdTypes - an array of Hold Types to use when putting a hold on this account.
        Returns:
        the created trouble ticket

      • addHoldAndTroubleTicket

        void addHoldAndTroubleTicket(HoldType[] holdTypes,
                           TroubleTicket troubleTicket)
        Adds a hold to this account using the specified hold types. Puts the holds on the given trouble ticket, which is linked to this account
        Parameters:
        holdTypes - an array of Hold Types to use when putting a hold on this account.
        troubleTicket - the Trouble Ticket to link to this account

      • releaseHold

        void releaseHold(HoldType[] holdTypes)
        Removes the specified hold types from the hold on the account. Closes the associated trouble ticket if there are no more holdtypes on the trouble ticket. Does nothing if the account doesn't have any open trouble tickets.
        Parameters:
        holdTypes - an array of Hold Types to release from this account.

      • getRecipientsOfCorrespondence

        java.util.List<AccountContact> getRecipientsOfCorrespondence(AcctCorrespondenceType correspondenceType)
        Parameters:
        correspondenceType - a type of correspondence (such as informational invoices)
        Returns:
        all AccountContacts that are recipients of this passed in AcctCorrespondenceType

      • redistributeAccountUnappliedFunds

        @Deprecated
void redistributeAccountUnappliedFunds(DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        Deprecated. Use redistributeDefaultUnappliedFund(gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) instead. (Since 8.0.0)
        This method iterates through existing non-zero dollar payments and redistributes them. It then pays charges using Default Unapplied. Payments are sorted LIFO (newest first) to decrease possibility of money in unapplied not belonging to the payment.
        Parameters:
        context - the context in which the unapplied fund amount should be redistributed.

      • redistributeDefaultUnappliedFund

        void redistributeDefaultUnappliedFund(DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        This method iterates through existing non-zero dollar payments and redistributes them. It then pays charges using Default Unapplied. Payments are sorted LIFO (newest first) to decrease possibility of money in unapplied not belonging to the payment.
        Parameters:
        context - the context in which the unapplied fund amount should be redistributed.

      • redistributeAnyUnappliedFunds

        void redistributeAnyUnappliedFunds(DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        The AutomaticDisbursementDistributedWorker calls this to redistribute payments before issuing disbursements. This method iterates through existing non-zero dollar payments and redistributes them. It then pays charges using the unapplied T-account for the invoice stream for the charge. Payments are sorted LIFO (newest first) to decrease possibility of money in unapplied not belonging to the payment. For the billing levels account level billing or policy level billing with default unapplied this method is interchangeable with redistributeDefaultUnappliedFund(gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext).
        Parameters:
        context - the context in which the unapplied fund amount should be redistributed.

      • hasValidParentAccount

        boolean hasValidParentAccount()
        Verifies that this account has a valid (or null) parent account. Only checks to make sure it doesn't point to itself, does not try to find "cycles" in parents.
        Returns:
        true if parent account is not self or if it's null, or false if it points to itself.

        Returns:
        true the current user can view this account

        @Deprecated

        Deprecated. this method does not actually return the payment moneys in any particular order; use the equivalent but more accurately named findAllPaymentMoneys() instead and then use orderBy after calling select() or Processor on the resulting query. (Since 8.0.0)

      • allotAllFunds

        void allotAllFunds()
        Iterates over all of the unapplied funds belonging to this account, and allots funds for funds tracking from the fundsSourceTrackers to the fundsUseTrackers which are unallotted or partially unallotted. This will respect unapplied funds' boundaries and only allot trackers to other trackers belonging to the same unapplied fund.

      • addToPaymentPlans

        Parameters:
        paymentPlan - to add to list of preferred payment plans on this account.

      • resyncPaymentPlans

        void resyncPaymentPlans(java.util.List<PaymentPlan> newPaymentPlans)
        Replaces PaymentPlans associated with this uncommitted Account

        NOTE: This method can only be called on a new Account (One that has yet to be committed). Once an Account is committed, removal of PaymentPlans is prohibited and only new PaymentPlans can be added via addToPaymentPlans(gw.bc.invoice.entity.PaymentPlan)

        Parameters:
        newPaymentPlans - New List of PaymentPlans this Account should have

      • isDueDateBilling

        java.lang.Boolean isDueDateBilling()
        Returns whether the account is using due date billing. If true the account's invoice days are the days invoices are due. If false the invoice days are the days invoices are sent.

        Returns:

      • createSplinterAccountForCurrency

        Account createSplinterAccountForCurrency(Currency currency)
        Create a splinter account for the specified currency associated with the mixed currency account group for this account.

        This creates a mixed currency splinter account group if necessary, which will have this account as its main account. The group and/or the account will be created in this account's bundle (which of course should be writable). There should be only one account per each currency.

        Parameters:
        currency - The currency for which the account is to be created.
        Returns:
        The created account.

        AccountAdjustment makeAdjustment(MonetaryAmount adjustment)
        This adjusts funds in the default UnappliedFund of this account. Use UnappliedFund.makeAdjustment(gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount) to adjust a different UnappliedFund. See here for more info about an adjustment.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns true if the close date of the account is non-null.

      • canClose

        boolean canClose()
        Returns true if all of the following conditions hold for the account:
        • the account is not closed
        • it has no open policies
        • the remaining balance is zero
        • all charges on the account are fully earned

        • close

          void close()
          Closes the account:
          • sets the closure status to "closed"
          • fires accountClosed event.

          Throws:
          java.lang.IllegalStateException - if canClose() returns false.

        • getAccountEvaluation

          AccountEvaluation getAccountEvaluation()
          Get Account Evaluation rating. This will be something like Excellent, Good, Fair, or Poor depending on whether the account has ever had late payments etc.
          Returns:
          account Evaluation rating

        • getAccountEvaluationDisplayText

          java.lang.String getAccountEvaluationDisplayText()
          Returns:
          UI displayable text for the AccountEvaluation. This will be something like "Payment History - Poor for the past 360 days".

        • getAccountEvaluationDelinquencies

          DelinquencyProcess[] getAccountEvaluationDelinquencies()
          Returns:
          all DelinquencyProcesses that should be included in the Account Evaluation calcuation for this account

        • getNumberOfDelinquencies

          int getNumberOfDelinquencies(int numberOfDays,
                           boolean countUniqueDelinquenciesOnly)
          Get the number of delinquencies that have occurred on this account during the last numberOfDays days
          Parameters:
          numberOfDays - specifies how long ago to begin the query for delinquency processes on this account. So one end point for the query is that many days ago, the other end point is today.
          countUniqueDelinquenciesOnly - true means multiple delinquencies resulting from same event will count as only one delinquency for account evaluation (eg: one missed payment on account with 4 policies making all 4 policies delinquent would count as only one delinquency)
          Returns:
          the number of delinquencies that have occurred on this account during the last numberOfDays days AND that have progressed to a point beyond the delinquency grace period

        • getNumberOfDelinquenciesPastGracePeriod

          int getNumberOfDelinquenciesPastGracePeriod(int numberOfDays,
                                          boolean countUniqueDelinquenciesOnly)
          Get the number of delinquencies that have occurred on this account during the last numberOfDays days AND which have progressed to a point beyond the delinquency grace period.
          Parameters:
          numberOfDays - specifies how long ago to begin the query for delinquency processes on this account. So one end point for the query is that many days ago, the other end point is today.
          countUniqueDelinquenciesOnly - true means multiple delinquencies resulting from same event will count as only one delinquency for account evaluation (eg: one missed payment on account with 4 policies making all 4 policies delinquent would count as only one delinquency)
          Returns:
          the number of delinquencies that have occurred on this account during the last numberOfDays days AND that have progressed to a point beyond the delinquency grace period

        • getNumberOfPejorativePaymentReversals

          int getNumberOfPejorativePaymentReversals(int numberOfDays)
          Get the number of pejorative payment reversals that have occurred on this account during the last numberOfDays days.
          Parameters:
          numberOfDays - specifies how long ago to begin the query for pejorative payment reversals on this account. So one end point for the query is that many days ago, the other end point is today.
          Returns:
          the number of pejorative payment reversals that have occurred on this account during the last numberOfDays days

        • getNumberOfPolicyCancellations

          int getNumberOfPolicyCancellations(int numberOfDays,
                                 boolean countUniqueCancellationsOnly)
          Get the number of policy cancellations that have occurred on policies assocated with this account during the last numberOfDays days.
          Parameters:
          numberOfDays - specifies how long ago to begin the query for cancellations on policies of this account. So one end point for the query is that many days ago, the other end point is today.
          countUniqueCancellationsOnly - true means multiple policy cancellations resulting from the same instance of delinquency will count as only one cancellation for account evaluation (eg: one missed payment on an account with 4 policies resulting in all 4 policies going delinquent then being cancelled would count as one cancellation)
          Returns:
          the number of cancellations that have occurred on policies of this account during the last numberOfDays days

        • numberOfTimesDelinquencyEventReached

          int numberOfTimesDelinquencyEventReached(DelinquencyEventName eventName,
                                       int numberOfDays,
                                       boolean countUniqueDelinquenciesOnly)
          Figure out how many times in the last numberOfDays days that an Account has had an associated delinquency process that reached a certain process event. For example, how many times did any delinquency process on an account reach the DunningLetter1 event in the last 360 days

          Note that this method avoids double counting in the same way that getNumberOfUniqueDelinquencies() does

          Parameters:
          eventName - name of a delinquency event
          numberOfDays - beginning of time window for search for delinquency process events on this account
          countUniqueDelinquenciesOnly - true means multiple delinquencies resulting from same event will count as only one delinquency for account evaluation (eg: one missed payment on account with 4 policies making all 4 policies delinquent would count as only one delinquency)
          Returns:
          the number of times in the last numberOfDays days that a delinquency process associated with this account has reached the delinquency process event corresponding to the passed in eventId

        • getCompletedInvoices

          AccountInvoice[] getCompletedInvoices()
          Returns all invoices whose status is Billed or Due. Returns the invoices from oldest to newest
          Returns:
          array of Invoices

        • getFutureInvoicesSortedByDate

          AccountInvoice[] getFutureInvoicesSortedByDate()
          Returns this account's future invoices, sorted from earliest in the future the latest in the future

        • getInvoicesSortedByDate

          AccountInvoice[] getInvoicesSortedByDate()
          Returns all invoices related to this account, sorted from oldest to newest
          Returns:
          array of Invoices sorted ascending (old to new) by Event Date

        • getMostRecentDueInvoice

        • becomePayerOfInvoiceItems

          void becomePayerOfInvoiceItems(boolean createInvoiceForToday,
                             InvoiceStream invoiceStream,
                             ReversePaymentsWhenMovingInvoiceItem shouldReversePayments,
                             InvoiceItem... invoiceItems)
          Make this account become the payer of invoiceItems.
          Parameters:
          createInvoiceForToday - true if an immediate invoice should be created to hold all billed/due items being transferred -- future/planned invoice items will land "normally" (i.e., on future invoices according to the invoice item event date)
          invoiceStream - the invoice stream that these items will be on
          shouldReversePayments - if Yes, or if OnlyForNonPlanned and the item is not on a planned invoice, moves any portions of payments that were applied to the invoice items back to unapplied.
          invoiceItems - the invoice items that this account will now be paying

        • getUnappliedFundsOrdered

          java.util.List<UnappliedFund> getUnappliedFundsOrdered()
          Returns:
          A list of all of the unapplied funds belonging to this account, ordered with the default unapplied funds coming first, followed by all of the designated unapplied funds in alphebetical order by display name.
